candidates.title: Update dependencies
candidates.body:
This updates the following dependencies:
- curve25519-dalek: 3.0.0 -> 3.1.0
- hkdf: 0.10.0 -> 0.11.0
- hmac: 0.10.1 -> 0.11.0
- crypto-mac (sub-dependency): 0.10.0 -> 0.11.0

I skipped updating `displaydoc` because the [multi-line change](https://github.com/yaahc/displaydoc/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#changed) they did is annoying.

It is [usually recommended](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/guide/cargo-toml-vs-cargo-lock.html#cargotoml-vs-cargolock) that libraries don't include `Cargo.lock`, what is opaque-ke's take on this?

candidates.title: Implement common traits
candidates.body:
This is an attempt to make sure that all exposed types implement `Clone`, `Debug`, `Deserialize` and `Serialize`. As a bonus I threw in `Eq`, `Hash` and `PartialEq` because it was no extra effort.

I skipped on implementing it on the `XxxResult` types because their public members are covered, which works great for our use-case, but adding them would be simple.

`Hash` might not be appropriate in a couple of places, I wouldn't know.

candidates.title: Argon2 implementation
candidates.body:
I removed the `slow-hash` feature and replaced it with `scrypt` and `argon`. As per spec recommendation, I chose Argon2id, but I am no cryptographer and a different variant might be desirable when used in OPAQUE.

Fixes #179.

candidates.title: Rebasing v0.6 changes onto master
candidates.body: Includes support for client enumeration mitigations (introducing credential_identifier, server_setup), as well as support for fake credential response and the new "internal" mode for the envelope.

candidates.title: Adding support for "internal mode" and fake credential response + test vectors
Implement serde serialization and deserialization
candidates.body:
Provide a standard interface for serialization and deserialization using serde.

This makes it much easier to pass messages as part of protocols.

Fixes #166

candidates.title: Add zeroize on drop for keys, keypairs, and Client/Server Registration/Login
candidates.body:
Ensures that zeroize on drop occurs for:
- KeyPair
- Key
- ClientRegistration
- ClientLogin
- ServerRegistration
- ServerLogin

In order to test this behavior, we also add an as_byte_ptrs() function to expose raw pointers for each of these objects (only when test mode is enabled). Then we call zeroize directly on these objects and check that the pointers point to zero'd out memory.

Note that other methods that involve actually "dropping" the memory are flaky and inconsistent.

Closes #158

candidates.title: Zeroize keys on drop
candidates.body: Currently the main key structure is not zeroized on drop. This diff adds this best practice functionality.

repo.description: An implementation of the OPAQUE password-authenticated key exchange protocol
